docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF THE BLACK WARRIOR.--The steamer Black Warrior, JAMES D. BULLOCH, Esq, commander, arrived at this port on Monday morning at 11 o'clock. The Black Warrior left Havana on the evening of the 27th. She brings 14 passengers, and a large quantity of cotton on freight. There was nothing of interest transpiring at Havana. The weather was delightful, and the health of the Island remarkably good.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS. Last Acts of the Aldermen--The Broadway Railroad Project Lost--Building a Pier at the Battery--Tax Levy for 1854, &c. BUILDING A PIER AT THE BATTERY. THE NEW BROADWAY RAILROAD PROJECT. AN ORDINANCE FOR ESTABLISHING A RAILROAD IN BROADWAY. EVENING SESSION. AN ORDINANCE MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE YEAR 1854. THE NEW BROADWAY RAILROAD PROJECT NON-CONCURRED IN.

HONORS TO GEN. WOOL.; Complimentary Dinner from Citizens of Troy. TOASTS, SPEECHES, LETTERS, &C. GEN. WOOL'S REPLY. Speeches of Hon, David Buel, ??on. A. K. Hadley, Capt. Shields, &c. Letters from Chancellor Walworth and others. SPLENDID DINNER AT THE TROY HOUSE. THE DINNER. From Gen. Ross. From Senator Dix. From Senator Pratt. From Governor Seymour. From General Scott. From Hon. M. S. Latham. From Ex-Chancellor Walworth.

docs.lead_paragraph: Immediately after the announcement of the appointment of Gen. WOOL to the command of the Pacific Department, the citizens of Troy, anxious to testify their approbation of the high regard which they entertained toward him as a citizen and a soldier, issued a notice, which was published in the most prominent journals of the United States, that they would invite him to a banquet previous to his departure.

byline.original: SPECIAL REPORT FOR THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: TO THE SENATE AND ASSEMBLY: You are assembled for the purpose of framing such laws as are demanded by the interests of the people of the State of New-York.
